title: As Xi visits Russia, Putin sees his anti-U.S. world order taking shape
description: Ostracized by the West over his war in Ukraine, the Russian president has sought to build alliances with China, Iran and others in challenging the United States and NATO

title: Pope Benedict XVI's aide acknowledges criticism over memoir
description: The longtime secretary to Pope Benedict XVI has acknowledged that his tell-all memoir has been criticized for casting Pope Francis in an unfavorable light

title: 2 skiers missing in avalanche near Mont Blanc
description: Rescue teams are searching for two skiers who were caught in an avalanche near Mont Blanc on Italy’s northern border with France

title: The Iraq I never knew
description: Washington Post photojournalist Salwan Georges recently returned to Iraq for the first time since he and his family left in 1998 to document how Iraq has changed.

title: Millions of dead fish clog Australian river
description: "There are dead fish everywhere,” said Graeme McCrabb, a Menindee resident, describing the smell from the Darling River as far-reaching and pungent.

title: India cuts internet for 27 million people amid search for fugitive
description: The ban for all of Punjab state, as officials searched for Sikh separatist Amritpal Singh, is one of the broadest internet shutdowns in recent years in India.

title: Serbian president criticizes ICC arrest warrant for Putin
description: Serbia’s president says issuing an arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin will have negative consequences and will only prolong the war in Ukraine

title: Putin visits occupied Mariupol, staking claim to invaded Ukrainian lands
description: The Russian president flew by helicopter to the city, nearly destroyed by his invasion, a day after the International Criminal Court accused him of war crimes.

title: Fight over science holds up key UN climate report
description: Publication of a major new United Nations report on climate change is being held up by a battle between powerful rich and developing countries over emissions targets and financial aid to vulnerable nations

title: Pope offers prayer for earthquake victims in Ecuador, Peru
description: Pope Francis has offered prayers for the victims of the earthquake that shook vast swaths of territory in Ecuador and parts of Peru

title: Syria's Assad in UAE to mark ongoing thaw in relations
description: Syrian President Bashar Assad has arrived in the United Arab Emirates Sunday, his first visit to the wealthy Gulf country since the devastating earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria last month

title: Man stabbed to death on a carousel at a German funfair
description: Officials have shut down a large funfair in western Germany after a man was stabbed to death on a carousel Saturday night

title: Netanyahu urges military chief to contain reservist protest
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has urged the military’s chief of staff to contain a wave of protest from within the ranks over a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: Qatar charges ex-finance minister with bribery, embezzlement
description: Qatar had announced the nation’s former finance minister faces charges including bribery and embezzlement from his time in the post

title: Bosnia: rights activists assaulted following LGBT event ban
description: Rights activists in the Serb-run part of Bosnia have been assaulted, hours after police banned an LGBT event planned there over the weekend, citing security concerns

title: 19 die, over 20 injured in bus crash in central Bangladesh
description: A speeding bus has fallen into a roadside ditch in central Bangladesh, leaving at least 19 people dead and more than 20 others injured

title: Palestinian militant group: commander assassinated in Syria
description: The Palestinian militant group Islamic Jihad says one of its commanders has been killed in Syria in what it described as an assassination by Israeli agents

title: State news: Kuwait court annuls 2022 parliamentary election
description: A Kuwaiti court has annulled the results of a parliamentary election held last year, saying it would reinstate the previous slate of lawmakers elected in 2020

title: The children of troops lost to Iraq War are all grown up
description: American families shattered by the Iraq War face an enduring sense of absence and the endless quest to understand their parents’ legacies.

title: In Zimbabwe's rainy season, women forage for wild mushrooms
description: Zimbabwe’s rainy season brings a bonanza of wild mushrooms, which many rural families feast upon and sell to boost their incomes

title: Israel, Palestinians meet in Egypt to ease tensions
description: Israeli and Palestinian officials are meeting in the Egyptian resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh in a bid to ease tensions between the sides and rein in a spiral of violence ahead of a sensitive holiday period beginning this week

title: Russian president Putin visits occupied city of Mariupol
description: Russian news agencies say Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited the port city of Mariupol, his first trip to Ukrainian territory that Moscow illegally annexed in September

title: Macron's leadership at risk amid tensions over pension plan
description: A parody photo appearing on protest signs and online in France shows President Emmanuel Macron sitting on piles of garbage

title: Ukraine live briefing: Putin visits occupied Mariupol and Crimea; Xi heads to Moscow
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a surprise visit to occupied areas of Ukraine, ignoring a warrant for his arrest issued by the International Criminal Court.

title: ‘Dear Vladimir Vladimirovich’ — Russian conscripts decry ‘criminal orders’
description: Russian military conscripts have issued a series of video appeals to President Vladimir Putin pleading with him to intervene so they are not sent to certain death in Ukraine.

title: At least 14 killed after 6.8-magnitude earthquake hits Ecuador and Peru
description: Another 381 people were injured in Ecuador as an earthquake shattered buildings and crushed a car. Tremors were felt as far as northern Peru.
